Install Problems



  • 2005-12-20 22:15:48

    Install Problems

    I was able to install ATutor on my home computer but I've run into problems as I try to install it in a hosted environment. I'm able to move the files to the server but I'm not able to complete the install. Please note that I'm not a PHP expert!

    Here is the output of the requirements screen when I try to run the install:

    Web-server: MS-IIS/6.0 Status=Good
    PHP: 4.3.11 Detected Status = Fail
    zlib: Disabled Status = Fail
    mysql: Disabled Status = Fail
    safe_mode=off off Status=Good
    file_uploads=on off Status=Fail
    sessions disabled Status=Fail
    session.save_path Directory Writeable Status=Good
    . in include_path Disabled Status=Fail
    MySQL Options Found Unknown Version Status=Good

    Here is the output from php.info:

    Here is the output from when I run get_loaded_extensions:

    [0] => standard
    [1] => bcmath

    [20] => xmlrpc
    [21] => xslt

    So my questions are:

    1) Why do I get a PHP error when it detects a newer version of PHP?
    2) Why do I receive a zlib and mysql error when both of these extensions have been loaded?
    3) Why does ATutor think that file_uploads=off when phpinfo shows it is on?
    4) Why does ATutor think that sessions is disabled when phpinfo shows it is enabled?

    Thanks in advance.


  • 2005-12-23 08:28:33

    Re: Install Problems

    Similar problems seem to occur for others when using the PHP CGI with IIS. Unfortunately we don't have an IIS server to duplicate problem.

    IIS and PHP do not work as well as Apache and PHP. If possible, I suggest switching to Apache. All the problems should go away with Apache.

    [reply][b]In reply to:[/b]
    I
    [op]forums/view.php?fid=7;pid=6672;page=1#6672[/op][/reply]
